column4: does anyone know how I can set the default size of a terminal window? I've added edited gnome-terminal.desktop so that if I use the shortcut in Applications > Accessories > Terminal it opens nice and big, but if I just use the Ctrl + t shortcut I've got, then it opens it the original small size.
have you tried right-clicking the window title bar for the terminal and choosing resize .. this sometimes sticks.
hmm.. nah that didnt help :( do you maybe know what file I can edit to change the command thats run when I hit Ctrl + t?
nope don't know .. Advanced Desktop Effects for Compiz seems to have ways of setting certain windows preferences for individual apps but I've never played around with them
